The public schools will be divided into six classifications instead of the seven of recent years, while the private schools will have two classifications. Click #isupportlocal for more information on supporting our local journalists. Just click ‚ÄúGift this Article‚Äù on this page, then copy the link or enter their email. Gifts are exclusive to subscribers, reset monthly, and each article can be redeemed once. Lake-effect snow is the sneakiest kind. The sky looks ‚Äúfine,‚Äù then you hit a band and it‚Äôs instant whiteout‚Äîno shoulder, no lines, just brake lights and panic. That‚Äôs why an ‚Äúarctic blast‚Äù story only matters when it‚Äôs roads-first: sudden drops in visibility, fast accumulation in localized zones, and a travel day that turns into a tow bill. Although the federal government shutdown is interfering with the Supplemental Nutritional Assistance Program that helps millions of low-income families, Kerr County food assistance partners stand ready to fill the gap. In Kerr County, 2,013 households totaling 4,082 individuals have not received November SNAP credits to their card since benefits ran out in October, according to the Texas Health and Human Services Department. Name: 1_college football_basketball_ncaa_nba
Representative_Docs: ["Inagawa helps pace Drake in 24-19 win over Butler to stay perfect in Pioneer Football League INDIANAPOLIS (AP) ‚Äî Logan Inagawa threw for 244 yards and a touchdown and Drake remained unbeaten in the Pioneer Football League by beating Butler 24-19 on Saturday. Drake's Isaiah Bragg returned the opening kickoff 32 yards to the Drake 34. On the first play from scrimmage, Nick Herman took the handoff and ran 66 yards to the end zone for a 7-0 Drake (6-2, 5-0) lead. Javascript is required for you to be able to read premium content. Sorry, there are no recent results for popular commen", "Six Players Ejected After Massive Brawl During St. John's vs. Providence As a subscriber, you can share up to 3 articles each month with friends for free. Just click ‚ÄúGift this Article‚Äù on this page, then copy the link or enter their email. Gifts are exclusive to subscribers, reset monthly, and each article can be redeemed once. A legitimate brawl broke out during the second half of this Saturday's game between No. 17 St. John's and Providence. With over 14:25 remaining in the second half, St. John's forward Bryce Hopkins went up for a layup when he was grabbed in midair by Providence's Duncan Powell. Not only did Powell hack Hopkins, he basically threw him to the floor. While we can't say for sure what his intentions were, it certainly looked dirty from the broadcast angle. Just click ‚ÄúGift this Article‚Äù on this page, then copy the link or enter their email. Gifts are exclusive to subscribers, reset monthly, and each article can be redeemed once. The Tennessee Volunteers had a disappointing season after making their first College Football Playoff in 2024. The Volunteers, under the leadership of head coach Josh Heupel, finished the 2025 season with an 8-5 record. That was after being ranked as high as No. 11 in the country. However, the team struggled down the stretch, losing four of its final seven games. As a result, it is now focused on building a championship contender for the upcoming season. Name: 2_united_arsenal_villa_chelsea
Representative_Docs: ['Doku, Bobb, Stones, Rodri, Kovacic latest: Man City injury list for West Ham clash By Oliver Thomas | 18 Dec 2025 08:05, Last updated: 18 Dec 2025 08:09 Manchester City will be looking to win their seventh game in a row in all competitions when they welcome West Ham United to the Etihad Stadium for their latest Premier League fixture on Saturday afternoon. The Citizens are in high spirits after securing their spot in the semi-finals of the EFL Cup with a 2-0 home victory over Brentford on Wednesday night, Prior to that triumph, Pep Guardiola‚Äôs men beat Crystal Palace by a 3-0 scoreline in the Premier League to climb up to second place in the table and move to within two points of leaders Arsenal. Here, Sports Mole rounds up Man City‚Äôs latest injury and suspension news ahead of the contest against the Hammers. Status: Major doubt Type of injury: Hamstring Possible return date: Unknown Oscar Bobb was forced off with an apparent hamstring injury in the EFL Cup win over Brentford and it remains to be seen whether he will be facing a period on the sidelines. Status: Out Type of injury: Leg Possible return date: January 1 (vs. Sunderland) Jeremy Doku has missed Man City‚Äôs last two games with a leg injury and Guardiola expects the winger to be sidelined for the next two', "Liverpool injury update: Alexander Isak, Alisson Becker and Jeremie Frimpong latest news and return dates Sport | Football Liverpool returned to winning ways with a 2-0 victory over Aston Villa to end their four-game losing streak in the Premier League. Pressure was piling on Arne Slot after the Reds slumped to ninth in the table, but even without a number of key players, the champions were able to sweep Villa aside to move back up to third. They welcome Real Madrid - Trent Alexander-Arnold, Xabi Alonso, et al - to Anfield in midweek, before they take on Manchester City in a mouth-watering encounter at the weekend. But will they have any of their star names back from injury? Ahead of a big few weeks, here‚Äôs all the latest Liverpool injury news and return dates... Alexander Isak has endured a tough start to life on Merseyside. Subbed at half-time in Liverpool‚Äôs 5-1 win over Frankfurt in the Champions League, Slot later revealed the ¬£125million summer signing had suffered a minor groin injury. ‚ÄúAlexander had to go off at half-time because he felt his groin a little bit. That's a pity,‚Äù said Slot. ‚ÄúI've said many times it is such a difficult balance to find with a player that missed three months.‚Äù Isak was not in the squad in the 3-2 loss at Brentford, and he also missed out on the Caraba", "Liverpool injury update: Alexander Isak, Alisson Becker and Jeremie Frimpong latest news and return dates Liverpool returned to winning ways with a 2-0 victory over Aston Villa to end their four-game losing streak in the Premier League. Pressure was piling on Arne Slot after the Reds slumped to ninth in the table, but even without a number of key players, the champions were able to sweep Villa aside to move back up to third. That's a pity,‚Äù said Slot. ‚ÄúI've said many times it is such a difficult balance to find with a player that missed three months.‚Äù Isak was not in the squad in the 3-2 loss at Brentford, and he also missed out on the Carabao Cup defeat agai"]

Name: 3_passed away_anthony_jim_lived
Representative_Docs: ['Anthony Duarte Birth: 1980 Death: 2025 Anthony Duarte, of La Puente, California, passed away on Wednesday, October 29, 2025, surrounded by love and family. Born on June 9, 1980, in West Covina, California, to Doreen Cardenas and Gildardo Duarte, Anthony was raised with deep love and guidance, and shared a profoundly special bond with his father Robert Cardenas, who helped shape the man he became. Anthony lived a life marked by warmth, creativity, and generosity. His kindness was as constant as his humor, and he approached every day with an open heart and an unwavering sense of purpose. Anthony‚Äôs passions reflected his deep belief in connection ‚Äî through both community and service. He had a profound dedication to civic life, demonstrated by his years of service on the Hacienda La Puente Unified School Board, his time working for a member of Congress, and his contributions to the California Democratic Party. Through these roles, he championed education, representation, and opportunity for others, always guided by empathy and integrity. Anthony cared deeply for his friends and made a lasting impact on everyone lucky enough to know him. He was the first to reach out when someone needed support and al', 'Anthony Duarte Birth: 1980 Death: 2025 Anthony Duarte, of La Puente, California, passed away on Wednesday, October 29, 2025, surrounded by love and family. Name: 4_injury_world cup_icc_zealand
Representative_Docs: ['In-form England must keep developing to have Six Nations chance, says George By Mitch Phillips England hooker and former captain Jamie George has welcomed the confidence swirling around the team going into the Six Nations but said they cannot expect to win the title by playing the same way as they did to build an 11-match winning streak last year. England last won the tournament in 2020, and their most recent Grand Slam was in 2016, both under Eddie Jones, but they go into their opening match at home to Wales on February 7 with more confidence that they can top the standings than for many years. After narrowly losing their championship opener to Ireland in Dublin almost a year ago, England have chalked up 11 successive wins, including a rare one against New Zealand, and coach Steve Borthwick has built considerable depth in his squad. ‚ÄúWe welcome the expectation because it‚Äôs a compliment for what we‚Äôve done and what we‚Äôve achieved over a short period of time, but it also keeps us on our toes because we know we can‚Äôt be complacent and can‚Äôt rely on previous performances,‚Äù George said at the Six Nations launch in Edinburgh on Monday. If we‚Äôre the same team as we were for the last 11 games, it will not be good enough, so our focus over the next two weeks is to', 'Australia‚Äôs Hazlewood unlikely to be fit for half of World Cup, Cummins says Australian fast bowler Josh Hazlewood may not return to action until halfway through the T20 World Cup, injured teammate Pat Cummins said on Tuesday. Hazlewood, arguably the squad‚Äôs most important bowler, has struggled with hamstring and Achilles injuries and missed the entire five-Test Ashes series against England. Australia head coach Andrew McDonald said in mid-January Hazlewood was on track to be fit for the squad‚Äôs World Cup opener against Ireland on February 11, but Cummins‚Äôs update was less optimistic. ‚ÄúI caught up with Joshy a few days ago, and he‚Äôs working so hard. I really feel for Joshy. He‚Äôs had a few setbacks. [He‚Äôs] one of the hardest trainers,‚Äù Cummins told Australian broadcaster Nine Network. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs doing everything he can. I don‚Äôt think he will be there for the start of the tournament, but he‚Äôs trying his best to be there about halfway through.‚Äù With Mitchell Starc having retired from the format and Cummins sidelined with back problems, Australia head into the February 7 to March 8 World Cup undermanned and in poor form after a 111-run humiliation by Pakistan, which completed a 3-0 series whitewash. Cummins said players‚Äô late arrival to Pakistan after the domestic B', 'Australia‚Äôs Hazlewood unlikely to be fit for half of World Cup, Cummins says Australian fast bowler Josh Hazlewood may not return to action until halfway through the T20 World Cup, injured teammate Pat Cummins said on Tuesday. Hazlewood, arguably the squad‚Äôs most important bowler, has struggled with hamstring and Achilles injuries and missed the entire five-Test Ashes series against England. I really feel for Joshy. He‚Äôs had a few setbacks. [He‚Äôs] one of the hardest trainers,‚Äù Cummins told Australian broadcaster Nine Network. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs doing everything he can. I don‚Äôt think he will be there for the start of the tournament, but he‚Äôs trying his best to be there about halfway through.‚Äù With Mitchell Starc having retired from the format and Cummins sidelined with back problems, Australia head into the February 7 to March 8 World Cup undermanned and in poor form after a 111-run humiliation by Pakistan, which completed a 3-0 series whitewash. Cummins said players‚Äô late arrival to Pakistan after the domestic B']

Name: 5_family_family members_gifts_friendships
Representative_Docs: ['Asking Eric: Family, friends don‚Äôt seem to appreciate time I put into tedious Christmas cookie tradition Dear Eric: My late mother made a special Christmas cookie that required tedious decorating, considering each person‚Äôs personal preference for toppings, and giving them as gifts to family and friends. They always had a place of honor on our family Christmas table. When she was no longer able, she gave me the cookie cutter, and my daughters and I took over the family tradition. It takes the three of us several days to make, bake, decorate, package and mail cookies to family members around the country. We enjoy doing it and feel like we‚Äôre continuing the fun and festive tradition. However, in recent years, not all of the recipients acknowledge receipt. At some point in their lives, they have all helped Grandma decorate, so they know the time involved. Because of past delivery issues, I track the boxes and inquire if I haven‚Äôt heard from them in a couple of days. Last year, one response was ‚Äúyes we got them.‚Äù This feels unappreciative! In the past most would text a picture of their children with the cookies, which we really enjoyed. We rarely see any of them anymore, as they are busy raising their families and don‚Äôt live nearby. This seems like a way for us to continue somewhat of a co', 'Asking Eric: Can mom work through tension in son‚Äôs relationship with dad so they can celebrate special birthday? Dear Eric: My son is turning 40 on December 22. My husband and I are at a quandary as to how to celebrate him. There have been issues between my husband and him over things from his childhood. We did a special trip for his older brother when he turned 40 and would like to do something special for this son‚Äôs 40th as well. Our daughter-in-law has made special plans for him and we are not included. I understand that, but I need some ideas as to how to celebrate this extra special year without rocking the boat. I love my son with all my heart, as I do all my children, and want his 40th birthday to be memorable in a positive way. Any suggestions? ‚Äì Mom Who Wants to Celebrate Dear Mom: The issues your son and your husband are having may be an obstacle, but they aren‚Äôt insurmountable. And the thing that can get them on the path to resolution is the same thing that can get you answers about how to celebrate your son: open communication. It‚Äôs not within your purview to try to fix things between them, but you have your own relationship with your son and so I‚Äôd encourage you to reach out and tell him what you told me: you want to celebrate him, you know things are difficult, and you‚Äôre lookin', 'Asking Eric: After 6 years sober, man is frustrated by his family‚Äôs hold on their hurt and distrust Dear Eric: I‚Äôve just turned 40 this past year. The last 15 years I was in a horrible drug addiction. I lied and hurt and did terrible things to a lot of people, especially my family. About eight years ago they officially disowned me. Understandable. I‚Äôve cleaned up and got my act together six years ago. At first, I tried to force my way back into their lives, which all refuted. I lashed out, said horrible things and stopped trying to be in their lives. My mom will stop by on my birthday for 10 minutes or so and drop a card off at Christmas. As for my two older brothers and my father, it‚Äôs radio silence. I guess what I‚Äôm asking is, what do I do to fix this and fast, as I said I‚Äôve turned 40 this year, my parents are both 70. Time is running out, and I couldn‚Äôt imagine living my life without some kind of acceptance from my father. Or knowing he did or does love me. My heart breaks at the thought, but this is a real pickle. How can I fix a problem when the ones I need to fix it with won‚Äôt talk to me? Do I just keep ignoring their existence and put on this fa√ßade that I don‚Äôt care to my wife and 4-year-old son? What picture am I painting to my son, as he‚Äôs been guilty by association yo']

Name: 6_surgery_hospital_patients_operating
Representative_Docs: ['VIDEO: $5.5M robotic surgery system arrives at Surrey Memorial Hospital Published 12:10 pm Tuesday, January 27, 2026 By Anna Burns The da Vinci Xi System has been unpacked and calibrated and is being held in a temporary location until its permanent location is finished. Fraser Health said that it expects it to ‚Äúgo-live‚Äù later in the spring. (Fraser Health/ Contributed to Surrey Now-Leader) Health care workers pose in front of the da Vinci Xi System. (Fraser Health/ Contributed to Surrey Now-Leader) Surrey Memorial Hospital is one step closer to providing robotic-assisted surgery with the arrival of the da Vinci Xi Robotic Surgery system. It is expected to be used in surgeries in the spring. ‚ÄúWith the aid of the da Vinci Xi system, we can expand minimally invasive thoracic and foregut surgery, and we can do operations with greater precision and accuracy,‚Äù says Dr Ahmad Ashrafi, regional division head and chief of thoracic surgery for Fraser Health. ‚ÄúPatients may experience quicker recovery times, and we can carry out more complex procedures right here in Surrey, using minimally invasive techniques. Name: 7_museum_egypt_egyptian_world largest
Representative_Docs: ["Egypt unveils the world's largest museum dedicated to a single civilization CAIRO (AP) ‚Äî Egypt is inaugurating on Saturday the Grand Egyptian Museum, two decades in the making, with the aim of drawing more visitors to revitalize the country's tourist industry. Located just outside Cairo on the Giza Plateau which also includes the three pyramids and the Sphinx, the museum will be the world‚Äôs largest dedicated to a single civilization. It will display over 50,000 artifacts detailing life in ancient Egypt. World leaders, including monarchs, heads of states and governments, are set to attend the grand opening ceremony, according to the Egyptian presidency which touted the museum as ‚Äúan exceptional event in the history of human culture and civilization.‚Äù The museum is one of the megaprojects championed by President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi since he took office in 2014. He has embarked on massive investments in infrastructure with the aim of reviving an economy weakened by decades of stagnation and battered by the unrest that followed the 2011 Arab Spring uprising. Preparations for the grand reveal have been shrouded in secrecy. The museum, which was opened for limited visits in recent years, has been closed for the past two weeks. The government has revamped the a", "Egypt unveils the world's largest museum dedicated to a single civilization CAIRO (AP) ‚Äî Egypt is inaugurating on Saturday the Grand Egyptian Museum, two decades in the making, with the aim of drawing more visitors to revitalize the country's tourist industry. Located just outside Cairo on the Giza Plateau which also includes the three pyramids and the Sphinx, the museum will be the world‚Äôs largest dedicated to a single civilization. It will display over 50,000 artifacts detailing life in ancient Egypt. World leaders, including monarchs, heads of states and governments, are set to attend the grand opening ceremony, according to the Egyptian presidency which touted the museum as ‚Äúan exceptional event in the history of human culture and civilization.‚Äù The museum is one of the megaprojects championed by President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi since he took office in 2014. He has embarked on massive investments in infrastructure with the aim of reviving an economy weakened by decades of stagnation and battered by the unrest that followed the 2011 Arab Spring uprising. Preparations for the grand reveal have been shrouded in secrecy. The museum, which was opened for limited visits in recent years, has been closed for the past two weeks. The government has revamped the a", "Egypt unveils the world's largest museum dedicated to a single civilization Egypt is inaugurating on Saturday the Grand Egyptian Museum, two decades in the making, with the aim of drawing more visitors to revitalize the country's tourist industry. Located just outside Cairo on the Giza Plateau which also includes the three pyramids and the Sphinx, the museum will be the world‚Äôs largest dedicated to a single civilization. It will display over 50,000 artifacts detailing life in ancient Egypt. Name: 8_pigment_colours_colors_color
Representative_Docs: ['The darkest fabric ever made is now a dress Get the Popular Science daily newsletterüí° Breakthroughs, discoveries, and DIY tips sent every weekday. Terms of Service and Privacy Policy. There is black, and then there is ultrablack. The shade defined as a black that reflects less than 0.5 percent of the light that hits it, is used on everything from telescopes to cameras. This uniquely dark color is not easy to produce and may appear less black when it is viewed at an angle. To find a better way to reproduce this cool color, a team at Cornell University looked to nature. Specifically, a bird called the magnificent riflebird. The result is the darkest known fabric ever created and it is detailed in a study recently published in the journal Nature Communications. The magnificent riflebird is a large songbird and member of the bird-of-paradise family found in New Guinea and Australia. Male riflebirds are almost completely black, with a green and blue metallic sheen on their belly, throat, and crown feathers. With the help of Mary M. Ferraro and Vanya Rohwer from the Cornell Lab of Ornithology, the team studied the riflebird‚Äôs black feathers. Their plumage comes from melanin pigment paired with tightly bunched filaments called barb', "Sam's Club Is Selling a Versatile 12-Drawer Organizer That's a Serial Hobbyist's Dream Come True As a subscriber, you can share up to 3 articles each month with friends for free. Name: 9_immigration_britain_immigrants_societal
Representative_Docs: ['‚ÄòUK public have tougher stance on immigration and diversity than people in US‚Äô People in the UK are less likely than their US counterparts to feel diversity strengthens society and more likely to have tougher attitudes on immigration, according to research. The findings are said to show that a common narrative about Britain being more socially liberal than America does not ring true across all issues. The National Centre for Social Research also found Reform UK voters in Britain were more likely than supporters of President Donald Trump in the US to say immigrants living in their country without permission should not be allowed to stay. While seven in 10 supporters of Mr Trump felt this way, the figure was almost eight in 10 (79%) among Reform followers. The researchers said they wanted to ‚Äúbetter understand how public attitudes in the UK compare with those in the US, and the extent of polarisation in the two countries‚Äù. Their survey found 42% of people in the UK think there should be legal efforts to deport immigrants living here without permission, compared with just a third (33%) in the US. While almost two-thirds (64%) of respondents in the US felt diversity strengthens society, only around half (49%) of the UK public agreed. Name: 11_hockey_scoreless_goals_scoring
Representative_Docs: ['Buium, Demko lead Canucks to 2-1 win over Devils as post-Hughes era begins Published 12:10 pm Sunday, December 14, 2025 By Philip Wolf Vancouver Canucks defenceman Zeeb Buium, in NHL action Sunday, Dec. 25, 2025 against the New Jersey Devils at the Prudential Center in Newark, N.J. ( photo) Zeev Buium had a goal and an assist in his Vancouver Canucks debut, leading his new team to a 2-1 win over the host New Jersey Devils in NHL action Sunday afternoon at the Prudential Center in Newark, N.J. Buium, along with Marco Rossi and Liam Ohgren, were picked up by the Canucks in a blockbuster trade for Vancouver captain Quinn Hughes on Friday. Jake DeBrusk had the other goal for the Canucks (12-17-3), with Thatcher Demko sharp in making 25 saves for the goaltending win. Quinn‚Äôs brother Luke Hughes scored for the Devils (18-14-1). Former Canuck Jacob Markstrom stopped 13 of 15 shots and took the loss in goal. DeBrusk opened the scoring just 61 seconds into the game on the power play, knocking home his own rebound in front of Markstrom. It was DeBrusk‚Äôs first goal in 11 games and ninth of the season. Eight of those have come with the man advantage. Buium made it 2-0 at 6:48, when he flipped the puck toward the net and it banked in off a Devils defender. Representative_Docs: ["AP Entertainment SummaryBrief at 3:08 p.m. EST Brendan Fraser's new horizons include 'Rental Family' and rental hedgehogs BEDFORD, N.Y. (AP) ‚Äî ‚ÄúRental Family‚Äù is Brendan Fraser‚Äôs first leading role since winning the best actor Oscar for ‚ÄúThe Whale.‚Äù In it, the 56-year-old plays a struggling actor living in Japan who, out of desperation and curiosity, takes a job with an agency that hires out actors to fulfill roles in real people‚Äôs lives. In an interview, Fraser discusses his life since the Oscar win, his eye-opening experiences in Japan and what returning to the ‚ÄúMummy‚Äù series means to him. His time in Japan included a visit to a hedgehog cafe. ‚ÄúRental Family‚Äù opens Friday in theaters. Copyright 2025 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. Name: 13_welfare_budget cuts_labour_social security
Representative_Docs: ['How much will DWP benefits and pensions rise following the budget? Benefits Budget 2025 Child Benefit Department for Work and Pensions DWP Pensions PIP Rachel Reeves Universal Credit National government Personal Finance DWP benefits including Universal Credit, Child Benefit, PIP, Carer\'s Allowance, and the State Pension are to increase in April 2026 after Rachel Reeves announced higher payments in her budget speech today. Anyone who claims DWP benefits should be in line for an increase in the next financial year, as the chancellor laid out plans to help pensioners, disabled people, parents, low earners, carers and unemployed people keep up with rising costs. Addressing MPs, Ms Reeves said: "The broken welfare system that we inherited wrote off millions of people as too sick to work and we will reform that system so that it is a system that does not count the cost of failure, but one that protects people who cannot work and empowers those who can. "We have brought back face-to-face assessments for disability benefits. Those are the face-to-face assessments that the shadow chancellor (Sir Mel Stride) got rid of when he was work and pensions secretary and our changes we have made to Universal Credit will get 15,000 people back into work, a figure con', 'How much will DWP benefits and pensions rise following the budget? Name: 14_major league_baseball_national league_garza
Representative_Docs: ['Braves To Sign Aaron Schunk To Minor League Deal The Braves will have infielder Aaron Schunk in camp as a non-roster invitee, reports Gabe Burns of the Atlanta Journal-Constitution. That indicates the CAA Sports client and the club have agreed to a minor league deal. Schunk, 28, changes organizations for the first time in his career. He was drafted by the Rockies in 2019, selected in the second round, and has been with that club a few weeks ago. With Colorado, he got into 55 big league games over the past two seasons. He stepped to the plate 131 times but struck out in 31.3% of those plate appearances and only drew a walk 3.1% of the time as he put up a tepid .222/.246/.302 line. His minor league offense has been better but not outstanding. In 1,170 Triple-A plate appearances, he has a .291/.348/.468 line. That looks good at first blush all those trips to the plate took place in the hitter-friendly Pacific Coast League, where that kind of production translates to an 89 wRC+. That indicates he was actually 11% worse than league average. The Rockies outrighted him off the roster in October and he elected free agency. Defensively, his reputation is pretty strong. He is considered an above average third baseman and has also spent a l', 'AP Sports SummaryBrief at 3:08 p.m. EST MLB pitchers Emmanuel Clase and Luis Ortiz charged with taking bribes to rig pitches for bettors NEW YORK (AP) ‚Äî Two Major League Baseball pitchers have been indicted on charges they took bribes to give sports bettors advance notice of the types of pitches they‚Äôd throw and intentionally tossed balls instead of strikes to ensure successful bets. Emmanuel Clase and Luis Ortiz both pitched for the Cleveland Guardians. They have been on non-disciplinary paid leave since July while Major League Baseball investigated what it said was unusually high in-game betting activity when they pitched. A lawyer for Ortiz declined to comment when contacted by The Associated Press and a lawyer for Clase did not immediately return messages seeking comment. Paul Tagliabue, NFL commissioner of 17 years who led an era of riches and expansion, dies at 84 NEW YORK (AP) ‚Äî Paul Tagliabue, who helped bring labor peace and riches to the NFL during his 17 years as commissioner but was criticized for not taking stronger action on concussions, died Sunday from heart failure at 84 years old. NFL spokesman Brian McCarthy said Tagliabue‚Äôs family informed the league of his death in Chevy Chase, Maryland. Tagliabue, w', 'Shohei Ohtani, Aaron Judge are baseball‚Äôs historic most valuable players As a gripping postseason made clear in recent weeks, this is a lustrous baseball era, one molded by titans and enjoyed across oceans. Thursday night‚Äôs crowning of Shohei Ohtani of the Los Angeles Dodgers and Aaron Judge of the New York Yankees as this year‚Äôs National League and American League most valuable players offered a reminder of its rarity. One race yielded as tough a call as anyone can remember, with another huge season from one of the greatest hitters of the century in Judge pitted against what might have been the best all-around season ever by a catcher from Cal Raleigh. The other race was over almost as soon as Ohtani stepped on a major league pitching mound in June, provided he stayed healthy. He has won four MVP awards in the past five seasons and three straight since 2023. He is alone behind only Barry Bonds, who won seven, for the most MVP awards in MLB history. Last year, Ohtani joined Frank Robinson as the only player to win an MVP award in both leagues. This year, Ohtani became the first player to win the award in both leagues twice. He was a unanimous choice by Baseball Writers‚Äô Association of America voters. Ohtani‚Äôs achievements remain impossible to overstate.']

Name: 16_africa_south africa_students_tourists
Representative_Docs: ['Minnesota high schoolers prepare for once-in-lifetime learning trip to Africa ASHBY, Minn. ‚Äî There are field trips and there are field trips. Students at Ashby High School are busy raising money and getting ready to pack their bags for a two-week learning experience in South Africa. ADVERTISEMENT When it is below zero, the main street in Ashby, Minnesota, is quiet. Fewer than 500 people call this Grant County town home, but lately the town is busy rallying around a group of high school students. In the basement of Peace Grue Lutheran in the middle of town, five high school students join veteran church quilters in tying quilts that the students will take on their trip to South Africa. "There is a reason the church ladies do this and not the guys," joked Kevin Fick, the girls\' weightlifting coach and organizer of the trip, of tying quilts the students will take with them as gifts. Five girls, along with Fick and four adult chaperones, will make the trip to Eastern Cape, South Africa, from Feb. 28 through March 10. Not as tourists, but to learn about conservation on another continent. "Not a lot of kids get to do this," said student Hadley Hokanson, student. They will work a sheep ranch, fish for sharks, harvest their own food, camp in the bushes and more. Name: 17_rebounds_bulldogs_scored points_school sports
Representative_Docs: ["Samford defeats Reinhardt 85-49 BIRMINGHAM, Ala. (AP) ‚Äî Judson Bjornstad's 16 points helped Samford defeat NAIA member Reinhardt 85-49 on Friday. Bjornstad also contributed six rebounds for the Bulldogs (7-6). Dylan Faulkner scored 15 points and added seven rebounds. Zach Lamey went 5 of 10 from the field (3 for 8 from 3-point range) to finish with 14 points. Tee Williams led the way for the Eagles with 14 points, eight rebounds and two steals. AJ Shaw added eight points, six rebounds and four assists for Reinhardt, and Blake Seitz finished with six points and two steals. The Associated Press created this story using technology provided by Data Skrive and data from Sportradar. For copyright information, check with the distributor of this item, Data Skrive.
